Reviews.Title: “Ok, not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: begUk
Reviews.Content: As someone already mentioned, I was too expecting a bit more for 150euro a day hotel. --- Positives: --- Locations was great, vaporeto station 20 minutes from hotel door; not too far from anything. Clean - ish. Breakfast was served rather than self-served. --- Negatives: --- Visited in February so heating was required, which was using a noisy air conditioning device. Found hard to sleep with constant noise coming from air conditioning device over my head. Floor was a very cold concrete and there were no carpets. Had to put my boots on just to go to the bathroom. Blankets looked tatty and not in sheets. I really hope they were washed for every customer. Stayed for 3 days and all three days breakfast was exactly the same - cold and a bit boring. We paid for canal view room but you could hardly see the very small canal so not worth to pay more for it.

Reviews.Title: “A Small Hotel right by the Canal”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn150
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only small and is very well situated right by the canal - 2 vaporetto stops from Santa Lucia Railway, and a nice walk from Rialto! The rooms are quite large and comfortable, and the reception staff were very friendly and most helpful. The breakfast was great, and again nothing was too much trouble. We organised a gondola ride starting in a side canal just near the hotel. It was wonderful - all through the back canals and 2 crossings of the Grand Canal, and for half the price of those from San Marco. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance, or you can just catch the vaporetto right outside the door and go further afield. We have stayed in Venice before, but this is definitely a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “So close to the Grand Canal...”
Reviews.Author: Naples64
Reviews.Content: Venice was our last stop on our trip to Italy and I was looking for a hotel with a canal view. The location was perfect - right on the San Marcuola boat stop. We arrived by train and walked there ( about 15 mins) but I would recommend just catching the boat. Our room was on the corner so we could see a little side can from both windows. We loved being able to look out and see what was happening ...gondolas, people delivering furniture etc. The rooms have air conditioning but you need to ask to have it turned on. The staff were incredibly helpful and we got some great recommendations for dinner, coffee etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place not too far from centra Venice”
Reviews.Author: trekker77Norway
Reviews.Content: In general I would expect a bit more for 140 â‚¬/night, but in Venice I guess the price is ok. We had a small room with a window on the street, but it is very quiet, so that was no problem. I guess the rooms with a canal view are great, but probably they also are quite a bit expensive. Another good thing is that is is less than a minute to walk to the water bus. I would advice everybody to buy a ticket for the number of days you stay right away. It may seem expensive, but afterwards travelling with the boat is free :-) Walking to San Marco takes something like half an hour. Nice, but you do not want to do it many times. The lady who welcomed us in the reception was very nice and took time to explain a lot of things. Also there are nice restaurants in the vicinity that give you a much better deal than overpriced lot around San Marco. The breakfast is just acceptable, but the coffee is horrible compared with normal procedure in Italy (yes, Norway is another story).

Reviews.Title: “Calm place in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: RikHD
Reviews.Content: PROS calm location, easy access from Vaporetto, clean, good breakfast, ok price for Venise, silent, CONS very small room, small showers when you are over 5 foot 9, they couldn't give us a good room even 4 weeks in advance

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Touristy_11
Reviews.Content: Venice can be tricky with luggage but this was too easy! From the train station you take the waterbus, get off the stop near the hotel and walk only a few steps towards the hotel - ideal for a family with children and/or lots of luggage. Extremely helpful reception staff and lovely breakfast.. Rooms were a great size and the view of the canals lovely. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay, and we'd return”
Reviews.Author: kootenaybill
Reviews.Content: My companion and I were warmly welcomed when we arrived. We were offered a choice between two different rooms and we chose a 3rd floor corner. The weather was warm and humid so the cross ventilation was a plus -- although air conditioning was available and effective. The room was comfortable and clean, not to mention the wonderful views out the two windows. The bathroom was OK (clean, small) and the shower was very nice. Breakfast was ample and tasty, with excellent coffee, and service! The desk staff were helpful and spoke excellent English. We especially liked the location and access to and from the whole city. The Vaporetto stop is a few steps from the front door in one direction; the rest of Canneregio lies in the other. A fine place for a few days' stay in Venice. B. Wells, B.C. Canada

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here during the heat wave...”
Reviews.Author: Flex7122
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the heat wave earlier this month that hit Europe but we were cool and comfortable in our fabulous room with air-conditioning. The location was perfect for those coming by train. And when we made our reservations online, they sent us an online confirmation with detailed info on getting there, etc. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_Guy3344
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Italy in June with my now fiance (got engaged in Venice) and this hotel was perfect. It was fairly cheap for booking last minute (80 euro per night). We arrived very late due to mechanical problems with NWA, but they had someone waiting for us. It is an easy walk from the train station and also very close to a vaporreto stop, which was convenient. It was also away from the craziness of San Marco square, but only a 15 minute or so walk. Venice is so small, it doesn't really matter where you are. Staff: The staff was helpful in answering our questions and providing a map. They also called and made reservations for us at a restaurant. They also opened a bottle of wine for us that we had bought to drink before dinner one day. Breakfast: Pretty good for a free breakfast, especially considering this is EUROPE and not America. Assorted cured meats like salami and ham, cheese, rolls, yogurt, fruit, and espressos/lattes made to order. Very filling for a long day of sight-seeing. Room: Again, this is Europe, so the rooms are small (it is really unfortunate that a lot of negative ratings in Italian and other European hotels is because of room size). It was tight, but there was a dresser and an armoire. Fridge was also included. We wanted to sight-see, so weren't in our room much. Our room did open to a little square and a little canal, which was cool to watch people walking by in the afternoon while changing for dinner. Bed was ok. Shower was hot, though a little small. Overall, I would definitely stay here again upon returning to Venice. I did not use the internet, so cannot comment on it

Reviews.Title: “Don't ask for anything extra”
Reviews.Author: Badeen
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and bathroom nicely remodeled (very small shower however). The staff not particularly friendly nor accommodating. A simple request for an extra pillow was greeted with questions. One cup of coffee offered with the breakfast and breakfast not terribly good. Internet service is very slow therefore check-in for the airport could not be completed for our return flight. When asked, they did not have a map of Venice or of thelocal area. Were located right at the water bus stop but did not have a schedule or route of maps. Location overall is good but keep in mind very noisy if windows open because delivery barges come through and some construction unloading at 5 am. (air conditioning did not work well so windows needed to be open)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean and VERY friendly & helpful. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaCs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two delightul days with my wife and two adult daughters. Located less than a minute's walk from the San Marcoula vaparroto stop, convenient to Pizzale Roma and the train station. Friendly welcome and comfortable lobby. Rooms were very clean and beds comfortable. Lovely views from our second floor rooms. Efficient and quiet air conditoners cooled room very effectively on the hot July nights, allowing us to close windows to reduce noise (walkway to vaparroto stop was just outside our room, but noise was not a problem). A safe was provided in each room. Nice bathroom with shower and clean towels daily. Continental breakfast was delightful, served at the table, rather than self-service. Included were a variety of breads and rolls, jams, honey and butter; yougart, cerals. fruits, ham, sausage, cheeses, and juices, as well as cappucino and coffee. A very relaxing way to start the day. The entire staff was OUTSTANDING! Everyone was friendly and helpful - anxious to help in any way. Very knowledgable about the city, with great tips for getting around for a group of first-time visitors. You won't find a friendlier and more helpful group of people. The surrounding area had a wide variety of shops and restaurants. Vapparoto (with 36 hour pass) made it easy to get to get to all areas of the city. We couldn't havde been more satisfied with the total experience. Terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, clean hotel in good location. Great value”
Reviews.Author: heirapparent2
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights here recently for a romantic weekend. Had a very enjoyable stay. The hotel is well located next to the grand canal and a stone's throw from the water taxi stop. It has been recently refurbished but still retains its historic character. The staff are very helpful. My only gripe would be that the breakfast wasn't all too inspiring but other than that a fantastic hotel and good value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Flashby
Reviews.Content: On a Friday morning (Easter vacation weeks), it took 20 minutes to walk from train station to hotel. Only one bridge to hoist luggage up but best to pack light anyways. Clearly marked as it is right by the vaporetto stop. Very friendly staff for check-in. We had an early check-out and they were willing to work with us. Breakfast was elegant even for the standard issue continental breakfast. It was served and it felt nicer that way. I am always good with the continental supplies. Elevator is a freight and you have to hold button for the duration. I went with the stairs the rest of the trip, again pack light. Room was a standard guest room size with a bathroom with shower only. Bed was large and had sheets. I have traveled in Europe extensively and only found them at a few locations. Plenty of space for bags and a closet with safe. Older furnishings but it went with the hotel. Vaporetto 1, 2 and Night went right to stop outside the hotel. We could see the Grand Canal from out the window. A Billa grocery store was a few bridges away, nice wine store and several bars/restos in the immediate area. Buy some wine and kill some time waiting for the vaporetto enjoying the quiet part of the canal. An easy less than 10 minute walk back to the station on an early Sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westi_2204
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked this hotel for 10th feb - 13th feb 2009. we got a superb deal - a double room for 3 nights for 150 euros, probably due to the fact that it was just before carnevale time in venice (i checked the prices for the following week and it was more than 100 euros more). to get there from Piazzale Roma, which is the last place cars can go in Venice, simply walk to the vaporetto (water bus) stop and board the number 1 (direction Lido). There are many people about to ask at the vaporetto stop if you are unsure, or ask at the ticket office. Get off at the San Marcuola stop (3rd one after piazzale roma i think!) and walk down the right hand side of the church, the hotel is on the right. you literally cant miss it! you could also walk it comfortably in 15 mins, its not hard to follow on a map. Our room was slightly on the small side but perfect for all we needed, and very clean. breakfast in the morning was typical for what you would expect at this kind of hotel- croissants, bread, salami, ham, cheese etc, and also coffee/tea juice available. we were also albe to leave our luggage in the hotel when we checked out, which was placed in a locked room next to reception. The internet is also available to use downstairs, free for 30mins. As i have mentioned, the hotel was clean and tidy, a very well run family hotel. i have no complaints whatsoever, although i wouldnt have minded BBC or CNN news to watch while i was waiting for my girlfriend to get ready! (there are no english channels, although i was delighted to come back one night and find the england match on italian tv)!!! the hotel is in an excellent location, just around the corner from one of the main 'high streets' of venice, with many shops/restaurants when walking both towards the train station and right towards Rialto, St Marks, etc. A walk to Rialto took about 15/20 mins, and was quite a good walk passing all the shops etc. Also, ask at reception for a map, dont go buying one! i would certainly recommend this hotel, especially as i got such a good deal! maybe in the summer if i had paid upwards of 300 euros i may have felt differently, but for the deal we got as a young couple it was excellent! if anyone has any questions feel free to ask me!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel in Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: BelfastBarclays
Reviews.Content: This hotel was immaculate and the staff were more than helpful plus had the added benefit of being just beside a vaporetto stop. I loved my stay here and would definitely recommend it to anyone else. If I had one complaint it was that there were no English channels available on the television - not so much a problem as an inconvenience - it really did not effect the enjoyment of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mariabf87
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. The room was was spacious and oh so clean.. The elevator was a help with all the steps. The breakfast was excellent and I must mention the women who served us was the best. The front desk service was very good. The location near the water bus stop and within walking distance to the train was very good. We were able to travel to restaurants without difficulty with the water bus. There was a small canal outside our window and we enjoyed the view. The church bells was nice to hear as well. The restaurants and pizza 'shops' in the area were very good. The coffee bars were all around us. The shopping was great. We were 4 people in our early sixties and we found this hotel to be one of the best of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: chefnancyseattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a few steps from the Vaporetto Stop San Marcuola. It is very clean and nice - a good value. Breakfast was good. Room was fine. Some rooms were actually overlooking a quiet canal. The owner had re-done it recently and was keeping a close eye on things. Computer to use in lobby. Can walk to train station/Piazale Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: mountainmoose
Reviews.Content: First, if you are arriving by train to Venice, it's really easy to walk to Ca' San Marcuola (even with luggage). I wouldn't wait in the long lines to buy tickets for the ferry. It's only a 10 to 15 minute walk. When you exit the railway station, go left, past the ferry docks and lines of people purchasing tickets. Walk down Rio Tera' Lista Di Spagna. You'll pass through Campo San Geremia. Keep going straight and you'll eventually come to a bridge. Go over the bridge and walk straight down Rio Tera' San Leonardo. All of these streets are lined with cute shops. As you walk down Rio Tera' San Leonardo, keep an eye out for a yellow sign that has San Marcuola on it. The sign will be on your right-hand side, up on the side of a building facing you. You'll want to follow the sign and go right. This will take you away from the crowd and down some smaller streets. Maneuver your way left and you'll eventually come to the inn. If you find the church and the San Marcuola ferry stop, the inn is right there. We really enjoyed the hotel. We had a spacious room with a balcony. The bathroom was on the small side. The only thing we didn't like about the hotel was the elevator. It was the smallest, scariest elevator I've ever been in. I think it's something you have to get used to, or do what I did....just take the stairs. The location of the hotel is fantistic. We took a ferry down to St. Mark's our first night and ended up walking everywhere else after that. We learned a very valuable lesson our first night in Venice. Don't eat in the touristy areas.....especially around St. Mark's Square. We had a horrible experience at one restaurant and were forced to pay 100 euros by the polizia for half eaten pasta dishes. The food was so bad, we couldn't finish it. We never even made it through the rest of the meal and were treated extremely rudely by the restaurant. We were so hungry, we ended up having to spend more money at another restaurant. They ruined a 60th birthday celebration. The next day, we talked to a Gondolier who gave us excellent recommendations for lunch and dinner in Cannaregio (Al Fontego Dei Pescatori and La Fonda Menta). Both places were incredible. The service and food was unbelievable. It made our last night in Venice very special. If you want some memorable meals, go outside of the toursit zone.

Reviews.Title: “location great but.....”
Reviews.Author: dubaiuk
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights 1. Arriving the reception desk guy was great let us put our luggage in the back office so we could enjoy venice after or 12hr trip... 2. The room was clean shower was not very poweful and I would suggest a room at the back to avoid some but not all the noise 3, Air conditioning: every other hotel of this star rating that we stayed in on this trip had A/C that you could switch on if you wish BUT NOT THIS ONE we where told we were the only ones to ask for it and they switched it on in JUlY and that was that. So we had to stay in a now noise room because we couldn't close the windows and be eaten alive by mosquitos. Thanks for a very sleepless trip and no we won't stay there again shame because the location was fab. 4. One morning I went down to breakfast before my other half was told I couldn't sit at the first table beacause it was set for three (so move the settings) the other tables were taken or dirty from other guessed haveing just finished. I had to nip up and find the room key left my bag at the table and guess what they threw away my breakfast and then asked me 3 times if I wanted coffee and juice and 3 times I said yes and 15mins later I left having not had a drink of anything.... oh and the table set for three 2 seconds later the other reception guy let a couple sit there....

Reviews.Title: “Our Long Weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bermos
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights/4 days at this hotel last weekend. It was very enjoyable from start to finish. The hotel is in a ideal location, 2 seconds from the San Marcuola water taxi stop, next door to the Casino but more importantly 3 mins walk to the main street. The breakfast was ok,if you like good coffee and bread your in luck, there could have been more choices of fruit and cereal. The only thing that could be a bit annoying is that it is also beside a church, the bells were run to call people to mass at various times during the mornings....it was very loud so take it handy on the 'umbras' the night before. It didn't bother us too much though. The hotel staff were mostly very friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean, ornate and welcoming. I did have one request that they couldn't help me with, they didn't have an iron for customer's use. They should really invest in one for those guests like me who forgot their travel iron. All in all it was a great hotel and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly welcome”
Reviews.Author: LondonItalylover
Reviews.Content: We travelled by train overnight from Paris to Venice for my birthday and arrived rather tired at Venice station with only a 10 minute walk to the hotel. We were greeted with a warm welcome by reception staff. The ground floor room was lovely, overlooking a small canal, the hotel being a stone's throw from the water taxi stop to take you along the Grand Canal. I would recommend this hotel highly to anyone visiting Venice for the first time. It is reasonably valued and clean. Reception staff speak English and are very accommodating. The breakfast is a superb continental feast, with waitress service. There is also a great Tintoretto of the 'Last Supper' in the church adjacent to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: iandel
Reviews.Content: The room was fine - a little cramped, but comfortable, clean and the bathroom had a nice shower. The location is good - it's right beside a Vaporretto stop & you can walk to St Marks in around 20-30 mins. There are plenty of restaurants on nearby Strada Nova. It cost 140 euros a night - to me that's a lot for a 2/3 star hotel, but Venice - though lovely - is a rip-off in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bwikse
Reviews.Content: Only 50 yards from the San Marcuola vaporetto stop, the location is ecellent. Our room was on the first floor in the back of the hotel overlooking a side canal. It was quiet and romantic. The room was well appointed with marble floors and bathroom. The bed was a true queen size! Only complaint: the shower is miniscule. If you drop the soap, there is nowhere to bend over to retrieve it ! The breakfast consisting of croissant, yogurt, fruit,and a meat plate was excellent. The staff is friendly and willing to assist. There is a free internet terminal in the lobby. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay here”
Reviews.Author: mcassd2001
Reviews.Content: The stay at the hotel was great. We had a room on the side of the canal with a great view out. The breakfast was better than we were expecting for Europe with meats and pastries. Had free internet and the staff was very helpful when we asked for suggestions. It was very convient to the San Marcualo vaporetti and we walked about 10 minutes to a shorter spot to get to Murano Island. Our room looked just like the picture and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms need some updating”
Reviews.Author: BigBalut
Reviews.Content: I don't think there is a bad location in Venice but it couldn't get much better than this. Locanda Ca' San Marcuola is right at the San Marcuola vaporetto stop, which is only two stops from Santa Lucia (the main train station). You can walk to Santa Lucia, Dorsorduro or San Marco in 10-15 minutes. We also liked staying in Cannaregio because it was less touristy and less crowded than most other places. The lobby and pleasant breakfast room were well-lighted with high ceilings, stonework, and traditional furnishings. The staff were also helpful and there was an internet station at the desk. Although the room and bathroom were impeccably clean, the furniture, bedspread, tiny TV were quite dated. The room size was average, unlike the hotel public spaces, which were larger than expected for a quaint hotel in Venice. Considering the 140â‚¬ rate, we thought the room value was not great but maybe it was a good deal with the high rates in Venice. We observed a walk-in guest who haggled a rate of 100â‚¬ from the receptionist including a cash discount. When we inquired about the cash discount upon checkout, the staff refused to give it because we had booked through a website. The immediate neighborhood is full of restaurants, stores, and gelaterias, as well as a self-operated laundromat. We would especially recommend dinner at Osteria al Bacco on Fondamenta delle Cappuccine in the historic Jewish Ghetto. The Jewish Ghetto was very interesting with hip bars, bustling restaurants, and few tourists, only a 5 minute walk away.

HotelInfo.Name: Locanda Ca' San Marcuola
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio, 1763, 30121 Venice, Italy
